tit.e: Asuka no Kiyomi Hara no Miya
Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace
tit.cmt: I have rendered "飛鳥浄御原宮" as "Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya" because this seems to have at least a little currency on Google.
tit.e: Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Emperor Tenmu and then Emperor Jito lived)

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原宮（あすかのきよみはらのみや、あすかきよみがはらのみや）は、7世紀後半の天皇である天武天皇と持統天皇の2代が営んだ宮。
sen.e: Asuka no Kiyomi Hara no Miya, or Asuka Kiyomigahara no Miya, was a palace owned by Tenmu Emperor and Jito Emperor in the late seventh century.
Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya (also known as Asuka Kiyomigahara no Miya) was a palace owned first by Emperor Tenmu and then by Emperor Jito in the late seventh century.
Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya (also known as Asuka Kiyomigahara no Miya) was a palace where Emperor Tenmu and then by Empress Jito lived in the late seventh century.

sen.j: 奈良県明日香村飛鳥に伝承地がある。
sen.e: It is said that the palace was located in Asuka, Asuka Village, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to tradition, the palace was located in Asuka, Asuka Village, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: I assume that "伝承地" is meant to suggest that this was the location of the palace according to tradition. Please check if I have understood this correctly.
sen.e: According to tradition, the palace was located in Asuka, Asuka Village, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 近年の発掘成果により同村、岡の飛鳥京跡にあったと考えられようになっている。
sen.e: As a result of recent dig, it is now considered to be located in Asuka-kyo Ruins in Oka, Asuka Village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a result of a recent dig, it is now believed to be located in the Asuka-kyo Ruins in Oka, Asuka Village.
As a result of a recent dig, it is now believed to be located in the Asuka-kyo (the capital of Asuka) Ruins in Oka, Asuka Village.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』天武天皇元年是歳の条に、下記のようにある。
sen.e: According to the article about the events in 672 in the "Chronicles of Japan," the palace was built in the south of Okamoto no Miya.
According to an article about the events of 672 recorded in the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), the palace was built to the south of Okamoto no Miya.
According to an article about the events of 672 recorded in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 2文含まれていたため、後半の1文は原文・訳文ともに次の行に移しました。

sen.j: 「宮室を岡本宮の南に営る。」
sen.e: The palace was built to the south of Okamoto no Miya.'

sen.j: 「即冬に、遷りて居します。」
sen.e: Tenmu Emperor had moved and stayed there since the winter of the year.
sen.cmt: 「天武天皇が、その年の冬に宮に移り住んだ」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Tenmu Emperor had moved and stayed there since the winter of the year.'
Tenmu Emperor had moved and stayed there since the winter of the year.'

sen.j: 「是を飛鳥浄御原宮と謂ふ。」
sen.e: The palace was named Asuka no Kiyomi Hara no Miya.
The palace was named Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.'
The palace was named Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.'

sen.j: また、朱鳥元年七月の条に下記のようにある。
sen.e: Also in the article about the events in July 686, the era name was changed to Akamidori.
Also an article about the events of August 686 describes as follows.
sen.cmt: 2文含まれていたため、後半の1文は原文・訳文ともに次の行に移し、グレゴリオ暦に直しました。
sen.e: Also an article about the events of August 686 describes as follows.

sen.j: 「元を改めて朱鳥（あかみどり）元年という。」
sen.e: The era name was changed to Akamidori.'
The era name was changed to Akamidori.'

sen.j: 仍りて宮を名づけて飛鳥浄御原宮（あすかのきよみはらのみや）謂ふ。」
sen.e: Therefore, the palace was named Asuka Kiyomi Hara no Miya.
Therefore, the palace was named Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.'
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。
sen.e: Therefore, the palace was named Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.'

sen.j: これを信じれば、「飛鳥浄御原宮」という宮号は天武十五年（朱鳥元、686）に名づけられたことになる。
sen.e: Take this into account, the name "Asuka no Kiyomi Hara no Miya" was named in 686.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Take this into account, the palace name 'Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya' was named in 686.
Take this into account, the palace name 'Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya' was named in 686.

sen.j: 672年12月～686年7月までは、この宮の名がなかったことになる。
sen.e: Then it means the palace had no name between December 672 to July 686.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then it means the palace had no name from December 672 to July 686.
Then it means the palace had no name from December 672 to July 686.

sen.j: 飛鳥の諸宮の名は、豊浦宮、小墾田宮、飛鳥岡本宮、後飛鳥岡本宮などで分かるように地名をつけている。
sen.e: Each palace in Asuka had names of places: Toyura no Miya, Oharida no Miya, Asuka Okamoto no Miya and Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya.
The palaces in Asuka had place-names where they were located, as will be seen from the names, such as Toyura no Miya, Oharida no Miya, Asuka Okamoto no Miya and Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya.
The palaces in Asuka had place-names where they were located, as will be seen from the names, such as Toyura no Miya, Oharida no Miya, Asuka Okamoto no Miya and Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya.

sen.j: 異なるのが飛鳥浄御原宮である。
sen.e: The exception is Asuka Kiyomi Hara no Miya.
The exception was Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせ、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The exception was Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.

sen.j: 「浄御原」は一種の嘉号であり、朱鳥年号とともに、不祥を祓い天皇の病気平癒を願ったものであるという。
sen.e: "Kiyomi Hara" was a Buddhist invocation, so the palace was named in the hope for purification of evil and recovery of the Emperor from illness.
sen.cmt: 「嘉号」は調べ、「南無阿弥陀仏」とありましたので、念仏、と訳しました。
sen.e: Kiyomihara' was a Buddhist invocation, so the palace was named in the hope for purification of evil and recovery of the Emperor from illness.
Kiyomihara' was a Buddhist invocation, so the palace was named in the hope for purification of evil and recovery of the Emperor from illness.

sen.j: 大化前代の宮（皇居）は、多く飛鳥地方の中で天皇の代ごとに移っていた。
sen.e: In the Taika Zendai period, the palace moved with the subrogation of Emperors mostly within Asuka region.
In the Taika Zendai period (before the Taika Reforms), the palace moved with the subrogation of emperors mostly within Asuka region.
In the Taika Zendai period (before the Taika Reforms), the palace moved with the subrogation of emperors mostly within Asuka region.

sen.j: 大化の時に孝徳天皇は難波（なにわ）に難波宮（ながらのとよさきのみや）を造り、天智天皇は近江大津宮に移った。
sen.e: At the Taika period, Koutoku Emperor decided to build Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya in Naniwa, and Tenji Emperor moved the palace to Omi no Otsu no Miya.
At the Taika period, Emperor Kotoku decided to build Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya in Naniwa, and Emperor Tenchi moved the palace to Omi no Otsu no Miya.
sen.cmt: 指示書、統一リストに合わせ、読みを変えました。
sen.e: At the Taika period, Emperor Kotoku decided to build Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya in Naniwa, and Emperor Tenchi moved the palace to Omi no Otsu no Miya.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱に勝利し大海人皇子が、天智天皇・弘文天皇の都であった近江国（滋賀県）の近江宮から飛鳥に都を戻すべく造営した。
sen.e: Oamano Prince, who won the Jinshin War of 672, constructed the palace to put the capital back to Asuka from Omi no Miya in Omi Province (currently Shiga Prefecture) where was the capital during the periods of Tenji Emperor and Koubun Emperor.

Prince Oama, who won the Jinshin War in 672, constructed the palace to put the capital back to Asuka from Omi no Miya in Omi Province (currently Shiga Prefecture) where was the capital during the periods of Emperor Tenchi and Emperor Kobun.
sen.cmt: 指示書、統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Prince Oama, who won the Jinshin War in 672, constructed the palace to put the capital back to Asuka from Omi no Miya in Omi Province (currently Shiga Prefecture) where was the capital during the periods of Emperor Tenchi and Emperor Kobun.

sen.j: 翌673年に大海人がこの宮で天武天皇として即位した。
sen.e: In the following year, Oamano Prince ascended the throne as Tenbu Emperor at the palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 673, the following year, Prince Oama ascended the throne as Emperor Tenmu at the palace.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「673年」を補足しました。指示書、統一リストに合わせ、読みを変えました。
sen.e: In 673, the following year, Prince Oama ascended the throne as Emperor Tenmu at the palace.

sen.j: その後、天武天皇とその夫人で次の天皇となった持統天皇は、20年以上に渡ってこの宮で律令国家の基礎を築く事業を進めたとされる。
sen.e: After that, Tenbu Emperor and his wife, who became next Emperor (Jito Emperor), started a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes at the palace over the 20 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After that, Emperor Tenmu and next Empress Jito who was Emperor Tenmu's wife started a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes at the palace over the 20 years.
sen.cmt: 読み、表現を変えました。
sen.e: After that, Emperor Tenmu and next Empress Jito who was Emperor Tenmu's wife started a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes at the palace over the 20 years.

sen.j: 694年に藤原京に遷都され、廃止された。
sen.e: In 694, the capital was relocated to Fujiwara-kyo Palace, and Asuka Kiyomi Hara no Miya was abandoned.
In 694, the capital was transferred to Fujiwara-kyo, and Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya was abandoned.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせ、表現を変えました。
sen.e: In 694, the capital was transferred to Fujiwara-kyo, and Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya was abandoned.

sen.j: 日本最初の律令である飛鳥浄御原令もここで編纂された。
sen.e: Japan's first statute, the statute of Asuka Kiyomi Hara, was edited here.
Japan's first code, the Asuka Kiyomihara Code, was also edited here.
sen.cmt: 用語集にあわせました。
sen.e: Japan's first code, the Asuka Kiyomihara Code, was also edited here.

sen.j: 7世紀に編纂された『日本書紀』から、内安殿など様々な名前をもった殿舎が飛鳥浄御原宮に存在したことが判明している。
sen.e: According to the "Chronicles of Japan" edited in the seventh century, there were various palaces named such as Naianden in Asuka Kiyomi Hara no Miya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" edited in the seventh century, there were some palace buildings named such as Uchi no Andono in Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.
sen.cmt: 読みを変え、補足しました。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" edited in the seventh century, there were some palace buildings named such as Uchi no Andono in Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: 2004年、飛鳥京跡の発掘を進めていた奈良県立橿原考古学研究所は、大型の高床式建物跡を発見した。
sen.e: In 2004, the Archaeological Institute of Kashihara, Nara Prefecture excavated the Asuka-kyo Ruins and found remains of a large-size high-floored structure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 2004, the Archaeological Institute of Kashihara, Nara Prefecture, excavated the Asuka-kyo Ruins and found remains of a large high-floored building.
In 2004, the Archaeological Institute of Kashihara, Nara Prefecture, excavated the Asuka-kyo Ruins and found remains of a large high-floored building.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原宮の「正殿」であったと判断した。
sen.e: They confirmed it was the Seiden (Main Palace) of the Asuka Kiyomi Hara no Miya.
They confirmed it was the Seiden (Main Palace) of the Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya.

sen.j: 宮域は、南北800メートル、東西500メートルくらいの範囲に収まる。
sen.e: The area of palace measures 800 meters from north to south and 500 meters from east to west.
The palace fell within the range approximately measuring 800 meters from north to south and 500 meters from east to west.
